Professor '''Rashbold''' was a [[Man]] living in the [[wikipedia:20th century|20th century]] [[wikipedia:England|England]].

== History ==
Rashbold transliterated and translated the [[Edwin Lowdham]]'s manuscript on the behest of [[Michael George Ramer]]. The text was in [[Old English]] written in [[Tengwar]]. It described the [[Downfall of Númenor]].<ref name="Night"/>

He was described by [[Alwin Arundel Lowdham|Lowdham]] as a "grumpy old bear".<ref name="Night">{{SD|2d}}, "Night 68"</ref>

== Inspiration ==
The name ''Rashbold'' is a pun on [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s own surname, being a translation from [[wikipedia:German language|German]] ''Toll-kühn'' (meaning "foolhardy").<ref>{{SD|2a}}</ref><ref>{{L|165}}</ref>
